topics.body:
Have you guys ever created your own fictional universe?
Something original and stuff.

Mine was a dystopian post-apocalyptic future where the world is ruled by seven different cities called Capitols and each ruled by two consul members.
There's a race called Symbiotes that each have these awesome powers to do their exposure to a black-coloured alien living goo called Parasites.

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532edec96368723fbda00300#post_532edec96368723fbda00300
Oh yes, many times and many quite complicated.

For instance I've got one where its your typical high fantasy world, at least until the industrial revolution hit. This isn't a "magic goes away" sort of scenario either. Magic is still working fine and dandy in this world, and in fact magic users have become aristocrats who look down on people who need to rely on "crude and base machinery" for a living.

Elves are particularly dickish about this.

Orcs and goblins are all cockney and make up the overwhelming majority of the working class, humans are just sort of around, and dwarves and gnomes have become quite wealthy either supplying ore or building new gadgets.

Except that they don't make you look like Venom or Carnage.
Instead, they look like how they've always been like.
The only change would be their mental and physical attributes.
You'll still look human, but have awesome super powers (and a second voice in your head).

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532edec96368723fbda00300#post_532edec96368723fbda00300
Once. It was a generic dystopia future that was a rip off of City 17, and had a completly black girl (and I don't mean as in race) called Correr as it's daaarrk and edgy defender. 

It pretty much ripped off elements of Naruto and every dystopia ever.


The other one I did was a land called Nod where the people are more or less hippies that love  rock n roll. But a bunch of highish tech, pompous velociraptor Englishmen nobles banned rock and were general dicks. It had robots and steampunk and such. And the hero was some guy called Jeremy Bon Jovi, who freed the world through the power of rock.

...I still like the second one.

Side note:
Oh for fucks sakes news can't you for once get what you're citing correct?  Does anyone else know who nate silver is?  Well the news is citing him again, but they're not even quoting him right.  This time it has to do with the 2014 elections; short version is ten tossup seats and that on average each party has a 25% chance of taking each seat with the remaining percentage being unclear, but the news just jumped the gun again.  They're saying the gop will win one billion billion seats or that democrats will win a trillion trillion seats.

I'm annoyed cause they can't even get basic fucking third grade level math right.
I feel as though if you sat a 24/7 news anchor down in front a third grade math test and the teacher asked them, "Okay if you have a hundred seats and someone takes fifty how many do you have left?" chances are the news anchor would respond with, "A gagillion!"

topics.body:
*DISCLAIMER: I wrote this just after I got home from work and I'm fucking exhausted so this is going long winded, rambling, and really, really dumb.* 

So everyone pretty much agrees that copyright law needs to be reworked, but I very rarely see anyone proposing how it should be fixed. I can't go into actual legalism since I'm pretty much as far from an expert on the law as you can get, I'm just an opinionated asshole.

First we need to understand the key word of Intellectual Property, and that is property. I am now going to paraphrase heavily from one of my favorite books, the left libertarian farce Illuminatus!

1. Property is theft.
2. Property is liberty.

This seems like a contradiction, but is not. People simply fail to understand that there are to sorts of property, and the way to tell which sort of property is which is fairly easy.

If the given property is the sort that would be respected by any rational, non criminal individual, then it is property 2, and represents liberty. Examples would be things that you personally buy like a book or a dvd which are now yours to dispose of as you please, or things that you personally create.

If a given property is not the sort that would be respected by a rational, non criminal individual and in fact the only way to have it respected is through force or the threat of force then that property is property 1, and represents theft.

And here we get to copyright law. As it currently stands the laws are heavily weighted in favor of property 1. Massive corporations own the legal rights to works that are so goddamn old its hilarious, long since anyone involved in the actual creation of that work has died, or is able to take a creators work away from them through use of complicated contracts. They are able to crush works that neither claim owner ship of the property or profit from it (parodies, reviews, ect.) and frequently do so.

What's more the law allows them to restrict activities that are entirely legal. DRM only hurts the honest customers, the MPAA and RIAA don't want you to ever use any of their properties in a creative way, and all in all it is a classic FUBAR situation.

Now what can be done about this? Well copyright needs, first and foremost, to protect the actual creators of the content. Again, I am not a legal expert at all so I have no idea how this would be structured to protect groups while still not fucking property 2 in the ass. Secondly, we need copyright law to clearly define and protect consumer rights, and the rights to create commentary, review and parody of the works, and it needs to be done in such a way that proof of violation of copyright is required before even a C&D order can be issued. Burden of proof needs to lie with the accuser, and as the law stands now this is true if the case gets to court but even before it gets that far now a C&D will result in party being hit with it losing time and money which can easily cripple small, independent artists.

*TL;DR:* Martians abducted and replaced every US president since Jefferson as part of a plot to dominate our pitiful mudball planet.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

The irony is that private copyright infringement doesn't hurt companies, corporate copyright infringement does though.  So companies are getting worked up by nothing when other companies stealing their products hurts them far worse than any private individual solely stealing their product and yet rarely is corporate infringement prosecuted.
